document:
<sentence id="s1" text="Alterations in li>MEK1/2 occur in cancers, both in the treatment-naÃ¯ve state and following targeted therapies, most notably BRAF and MEK inhibitors in li>BRAF-V600E-mutant melanoma and colorectal cancer.">
<sentence id="s2" text="This work highlights the importance of classifying mutations based on structural and phenotypic consequences, both in terms of pathway signaling output and response to pharmacologic inhibition.Implications: This study suggests that alternate modes of target inhibition, such as ERK inhibition, will be required to effectively treat tumors harboring these MEK1/2-resistant alleles.">
